locutie.beschrijving: A meditation on the nature of shame (constructive vs. destructive) and how Jesus' crucifixion represents the ultimate endurance of shame as a substitutionary act.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Strong historical-cultural context regarding Roman crucifixion and the concept of 'shame' in the ancient world.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily explaining and describing the concept of shame and the historical event of the cross, with a late shift toward promising the benefits of Christ's work.
voorbeelden: It is important to understand what crucifixion was...
Jesus experienced the bad kind of shame...
The New Testament writers have nothing to say about the physical details...

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: The hearer should feel a sense of relief from toxic shame and be emboldened to confess sins honestly.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Low; the Spirit is not explicitly mentioned as the agent of transformation.

voorbeelden: Shame in its truest and best sense has to do with our standing before God.
Ancient Roman writers could hardly bring themselves to mention it.
Let's see if we can keep two ideas of shame in our minds.
Pay very close attention to the words of the next hymn.
You and I will never have to wear a dunce cap again.
commissieven.kwaliteit: The promises are powerful but delayed until the very end of the sermon.

voorbeelden: We may now wear shame... as the colors of the One who overcomes.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher speaks with pedagogical authority but rarely uses direct sacramental/absolutionary authority.

constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes an observer of a lecture on shame rather than a participant in a grace-event until the final paragraphs.

missende_elementen: Immediate address of the hearer's current shame
Present-tense proclamation of Christ's victory over the hearer's specific guilt

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: High quality but low frequency; the 'Toezegging' is the climax rather than the engine.
voorbeelden: Because he has taken our place... shame is no longer a burden for us.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Personal anecdotes and inclusive 'we' for humanity.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address used primarily in the final application.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: High; used to apply the work of Christ to the listener.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing Jesus, the Romans, David, and the concept of shame.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a historical and conceptual distance.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Definitions of shame and social commentary.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: The sermon avoids moralism; it does not simply say 'Be ashamed' (Directive).

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from the definition of shame (Assertive) to Christ's bearing of shame (Assertive/Commissive) to the hearer's freedom (Declarative).
voorbeelden: The shame belonged to us; the effects fell upon him... you and I will never have to wear a dunce cap again.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because he has taken our place... we are now able to stand upright.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon is a teaching meditation that culminates in a comforting evangelical promise. It functions as a lecture that turns into a proclamation in its final moments.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The shame belonged to us; the effects fell upon him.
sterke_punten.effect: Clearly establishes the basis for the hearer's relief.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Lengthy discussion of Newsweek and Russell Baker.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Delays the 'event' of the Word by focusing on social commentary.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It becomes an event in the last two paragraphs, but the first 80% is 'talking about' concepts.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher acts more as a teacher/guide than a mandatory of a creative word until the very end.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Implicitly through the text, but the preacher's voice dominates the first half.
tekstueel_bewijs: Our precious Lord hid not his face... you and I will never have to...

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicitly left to the hearer's response.

sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Moderate; the description of the cross is vivid.
tekstueel_bewijs: He... voluntarily stepped into the place of utmost humiliation.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon relies heavily on 'is' and 'was'. It needs more 'I declare' and 'He gives'.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: Shame in its truest and best sense has to do with our standing before God.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Today, God looks at your shame and calls you to stand before Him without fear.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a definition to an address.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is buried at the end.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Interweave the promise of Christ's substitution throughout the historical description.
voorbeeldzinnen: In this spitting, Christ is even now absorbing your specific disgrace.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Use 'you' more frequently to bridge the historical gap.
voorbeeldzinnen: He bore the shame that you are carrying this morning.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The balance is actually good; the indicatives are strong.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Keep the foundation but make it performative sooner.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A deeply thoughtful meditation that successfully lands on a beautiful promise of grace, though it takes a long 'constative' route to get there.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SAT identifies that the preacher isn't just 'sending a message' about shame, but is actually attempting to 'remove' it through a Commissive act.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: The analysis shows the power isn't in the 'Newsweek' illustration, but in the illocutionary force of the 'exchange' (The Son suffered, the slave sinned).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's 'event-character' is concentrated entirely in the final 15% of the text.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The shame belonged to us; the effects fell upon him.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: The theological heart of the sermon.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of the 'Teaching-to-Proclamation' arc.
